title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
description: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Wang wins Wimbledon women's wheelchair singles
description: Wang Ziying of China won her first Grand Slam title in women's wheelchair singles by beating top-seeded Yui Kamiji of Japan 6-3, 6-3 on Saturday at Wimbledon.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 'Who would have expected that?' - Swiatek triumphs on grass
description: Few would have predicted Iga Swiatek's best Grand Slam result so far this season would come at Wimbledon - including herself.

title: Numbers behind Swiatek's dominant Wimbledon win
description: If history has taught us anything about Iga Swiatek, it is that once she breaks her opponent's serve a dominant victory is on the cards.

title: How much prize money will the Wimbledon champion earn?
description: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz will meet Sunday in the Wimbledon final, one of the most highly anticipated matches in recent memory. Alcaraz recently saved three championship points to battle past Sinner in a memorable Roland Garros final. Fans have been waiting for their rematch ever since. Both men are keen to lift another Grand Slam trophy, but there will be more at stake Sunday on Centre Court. The winner will earn a significant addition to their tournament prize money. The Wimbledon champion will claim £3,000,000, while the runner-up will earn £1,520,000. Look below for a full prize-money breakdown of the singles fields at the grass-court major. 2025 Wimbledon Singles Prize Money (Men & Women) Round Prize Money   Champion  £3,000,000  Finalist  £1,520,000  Semi-finalist  £775,000  Quarter-finalist  £400,000  R16  £240,000  R32   £152,000  R64   £99,000  R128   £66,000 More On Wimbledon Final Rivalries: Alcaraz vs. Sinner What time is the Alcaraz-Sinner final? Poll: Vote for your pick in the blockbuster Alcaraz-Sinner championship clash [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What is the Wimbledon tennis schedule?
description: The No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings Jannik Sinner and two-time defending champion Carlos Alcaraz will face off in a blockbuster men’s singles championship match on Sunday at Wimbledon. The final will begin at 4 p.m. local time. View Sunday's featured matches below and the full order of play here. SUNDAY, 13 JULY Centre Court (starts 1:00 p.m.)  Su-Wei Hsieh/Jelena Ostapenko vs. Veronika Kudermetova/Elise Mertens Starts at 4 p.m.  [1] Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs. [2] Carlos Alcaraz (ESP)Read More from Wimbledon: Sinner seeks redemption vs. Alcaraz in blockbuster final Rivalries: Alcaraz vs. Sinner [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Wimbledon 2025 Day Twelve Recap
description: Wimbledon’s final weekend is set, and it’s the showdown everyone hoped for. Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz will meet in the 2025 men’s final after both came through their semi-finals on Day Twelve, though in very different ways. Sinner produced a near-flawless performance to dispatch a hampered Novak Djokovic in straight sets, reaching his first …
author: Jonathan

title: Wimbledon 2025 Day Ten Recap
description: The top half of the Wimbledon men’s draw held firm on Wednesday, as Jannik Sinner and Novak Djokovic both booked their places in the semi-final, though not without some questions. Sinner, who fluked his way into the last eight, showed no signs of discomfort as he dispatched Ben Shelton in straight sets, extending his head-to-head …
author: Jonathan
